text: You wake up in a small, dimly lit room. The air is stale, and you can't remember how you got here. There's a door to your left and a window to your right.
The door is locked. You notice a keypad next to it, requiring a four-digit code.

choices.text: Look around the room for clues

text: You peer out the window and see you're in a tall building, at least 20 stories high. The city below looks abandoned.

choices.text: Go back and examine the door

text: After several failed attempts, the keypad locks you out. A small screen displays: 'Security alerted. Please wait.'

choices.text: Look around the room for hiding spots

text: Searching the room, you find a crumpled note under the bed. It reads: 'The code is the year everything changed.'
The window doesn't budge. It seems to be sealed shut. As you examine it closer, you notice strange markings etched into the glass.

choices.text: Go back and examine the door

text: After a few minutes, you hear footsteps approaching. The door opens, and a person in a hazmat suit enters.

choices.text: Try to overpower them and escape

text: You find a small closet and hide inside. Through the slats, you see two people in hazmat suits enter the room.
You ponder the clue. Could it be referring to a significant event? You decide to try the year 2020.
Searching further, you find a small diary hidden in a crack in the wall. Most pages are blank, but one entry catches your eye.
The markings seem to be a series of symbols. As you study them, you realize they might be some kind of code.

choices.text: Try to match the symbols to letters
Look for similar symbols in the room

text: The person seems surprised by your question. 'You... you're awake? How much do you remember?'

choices.text: Tell them you don't remember anything
Demand to know where you are

text: You lunge at the person, but they're quicker. They dodge and pull out a strange-looking device.
You overhear their conversation. 'Subject 47 is still unresponsive. Should we proceed to phase 2?'
You step out of the closet, startling the two people. 'Who are you? What is this place?'
The keypad beeps and the door unlocks. You step into a long, sterile corridor.
The diary entry reads: 'Day 365 of the experiment. The outside world is no more. 2024 will be remembered as the year everything changed.'
After some trial and error, you decipher a message: 'The key lies in the stars.'

choices.text: Look for star-related clues in the room
Try to relate this to the keypad

text: You find similar symbols carved into the bedpost. They seem to form a sequence.
The person nods solemnly. 'I see. Come with me, we have a lot to discuss.'
They hesitate before responding. 'You're in a safe place. The last safe place on Earth.'
You manage to grab the device, but as soon as you touch it, a jolt of electricity courses through you. Everything goes black.
They lower the device, still wary. 'I understand your confusion. Let me explain.'
The other person responds, 'No, we need to wait. The Director wants to be present for phase 2.'
They exchange glances before one speaks. 'You're part of humanity's last hope. We're in the year 2075, and the world outside is gone.'
You walk down the left corridor and come to a large metal door marked 'Laboratory'.
The right corridor leads to an elevator. The only button is for the ground floor.

choices.text: Go back and try the left corridor

text: The keypad accepts the code. The door opens to reveal a high-tech laboratory filled with strange equipment.
You notice a small telescope in the corner of the room that you hadn't seen before.
You wonder if the keypad might accept star constellations as numbers. The Big Dipper has 7 stars...
